div.span: Changing the passphrase

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:1345px; width:215px; height:11px;
div.span: The passphrase can be changed through:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:1375px; width:254px; height:26px;
div.span:
yoU@B student Diary (youatb.unibocconi.it);
Self Service Password Reset (sspr.unibocconi.it).

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:1418px; width:470px; height:40px;
div.span:
Students are encouraged to enter their alternate contact information (phone number,
personal email address) in SSPR, which can subsequently be used to activate the recovery
procedure in case of a forgotten passphrase.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:1477px; width:117px; height:11px;
div.span: Passphrase recovery

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:1506px; width:477px; height:84px;
div.span: The passphrase for accessing the online services can be retrieved by using the Self Service
Passphrase Reset function available in the yoU@B Diary login screen. For this purpose,

students are asked to enter the original password or to answer to the secret questions
chosen when accessing the Diary for the first time and/or subsequently modified. An ID code
can also be sent to the student’s email address or mobile phone number (in this case, only if
contact information has already been entered).

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:1608px; width:240px; height:11px;
div.span: In case of compromised access credentials

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:1637px; width:475px; height:55px;
div.span:
Compromise of login credentials is the most common vector for cybersecurity attacks. This
intrusion occurs mostly through techniques called phishing which consist in sending the user

messages that appear to be authentic mails from an institutional site or from an
acquaintance. Instead, they induce the user to click on links that lead to sites purpose-built

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:1916px; width:119px; height:11px;
div.span: for stealing passwords.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:1946px; width:477px; height:26px;
div.span:
Once the credentials have been stolen, the student's email address and identity could be
used to conduct illegal activities that could cause damage to the University or to third parties.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:1989px; width:464px; height:40px;
div.span:
Students must be aware of these risks and other social engineering techniques aimed at
identity theft and, in case of suspicion, they should contact the Bocconi Security Operation
Center without delay at soc@unibocconi.it for verification. of the incident.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:2092px; width:19px; height:11px;
position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:2121px; width:120px; height:11px;
div.span: yoU@B Student Diary

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:2194px; width:477px; height:55px;
div.span:
The yoU@B student Diary is a reserved area online available to all Bocconi students.
Through yoU@B, students can receive information from the University, use online services
dedicated to teaching, administer some activities in their academic careers, check dates,
times and rooms for both exams and graduation sessions, check class timetables and so on.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:2266px; width:468px; height:26px;
div.span:
The yoU@B student Diary is available in both English and Italian. Students can change the
language of the yoU@B content at any time.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:2310px; width:266px; height:11px;
div.span: Students can consult the student Diary in two ways:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:2354px; width:379px; height:26px;
div.span:
Desktop version (which is the full and complete version of the yoU@B);
Mobile app yoU@B Pro (which includes only some of the main functions).

The desktop version is the full and complete version of the yoU@B student Diary and

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:2852px; width:112px; height:11px;
div.span: The yoU@B includes:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:2881px; width:429px; height:55px;
div.span:
a homepage displaying the widgets with communication from the various University
services;
a list of menus including, under each item, all functions available to students for
administering one’s academic career.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:2954px; width:432px; height:11px;
div.span: In addition to the widgets of the various University services, the homepage includes:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:2983px; width:441px; height:172px;
div.span: Notices
: for messages from the Academic Services and other University services;
To do list

: in addition to all main notifications referring to some student requirements,
this includes also the Teaching widget, where up-to-date information regarding
lectures is published;
‘
Your student ID Card
Exams

: includes the list of exam registrations completed by the student and a section
with the exam breakdown of students in classrooms for the exam date;
Sign-up for various activities

: to sign up for extracurricular activities; this function
can be viewed only if activities have been scheduled for the student;
Blackboard
: to access to the University e-learning platform.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:3174px; width:103px; height:11px;
div.span: Menu items include:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:3203px; width:441px; height:260px;
div.span: B in Touch

(>Home): a tool which must be used to contact some University services.
It includes FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions) organized by topic and subject.
Through the procedure, students can forward their request to the appropriate office
depending on the selected topic;
Punto Blu

: function that students can use to complete some of the most important
administrative activities;
Teaching
: including the main procedures supporting teaching (e.g. B-clicker,
Blackboard, Teaching box, Attendance register);
Registration exam session
(>exam sessions): to register for exams;
Class timetable
: to check the class timetable, by date or by code;
Check Faculty office hours
(>Faculty Office hours);
Certificates

: to access the cert@B procedure to submit a certification request, or to
access the 'self-declarations' printing function;
Events
Utilities
: one of the functions available here is the 'Update your profile' section, which
allows students to update their personal profile and change their password.

position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:3846px; width:126px; height:11px;
div.span: How to access yoU@B

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:3875px; width:450px; height:40px;
div.span:
The yoU@B student Diary can be accessed from the homepage of the Bocconi website
at www.unibocconi.eu/ or https://youatb.unibocconi.it. Users must log in and enter their
access credentials.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:3934px; width:472px; height:40px;
div.span:
It is important to note that yoU@B, along with the Bocconi email account and B in
Touch, is the University's main communication tool used for student communication.
Therefore, students are kindly asked to frequently check the messages received.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:4006px; width:108px; height:7px;
div.span: Last change 30/06/2023 10:15

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:4138px; width:467px; height:26px;
div.span:
The yoU@B student Diary is also available in a mobile version, offering students quick and
easy access to the most important content that is also available in the desktop version.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:4182px; width:435px; height:26px;
div.span: Because some content and functions may not be available in the mobile version,
the
desktop version of the yoU@B student Diary should be accessed frequently.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:4225px; width:454px; height:26px;
div.span:
Students can download the yoU@B Pro application, available free of charge for iOS and
Android devices.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:4284px; width:473px; height:40px;
div.span:

important functions also available in the desktop version of the yoU@B student Diary,
including:

position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:4869px; width:475px; height:40px;
div.span: By enabling push notifications

on the yoU@B Pro app, you can stay informed
regarding
deadlines for exam registration

, get real time information when communications
are available from various University services, etc.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:4928px; width:443px; height:26px;
div.span:
The yoU@B Pro app is available in both Italian and English languages. To change the
language in use, you need to:

div.span: Punto Blu

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:5219px; width:479px; height:40px;
div.span:
The Punto Blu function, which can be accessed from the yoU@B Diary, allows students to
carry out some administrative activities regarding their student academic career.
There are Punto Blu terminals on campus which allow access to the Bocconi website and the

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:5484px; width:480px; height:128px;
div.span:
yoU@B Diary. Some Punto Blu functions are only available from the Punto Blu points located
at the university, e.g. printing the unofficial academic transcript which is the document that
contains student's personal details and all the course listed in the program structure. The
transcript is subsequently updated with the dates and marks of exams passed and includes
the single grades of courses subdivided in modules (if included in the program structure)
valid exclusively at the University for rankings such as ISU scholarships, Exchange programs
etc.
Students can access Punto Blu only after they have completed the complete initial enrollment
procedure.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:5630px; width:434px; height:26px;
div.span:
Punto Blu functions are available both in English and in Italian and can be viewed by
students in accordance with the language version set in the yoU@B student Diary.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:5674px; width:239px; height:11px;
div.span: To access Punto Blu functions, students must:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:5703px; width:235px; height:26px;
div.span:
access the yoU@B Student Diary;
click on 'Punto Blu' from the Diary homepage.

div.span: Email

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:5921px; width:451px; height:40px;
div.span:
All currently enrolled students are given a Bocconi email account. Students can use this
account free of charge.
First-year students are automatically assigned an email address upon enrollment.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:5980px; width:471px; height:26px;
div.span: The email can be accessed either at outlook.unibocconi.it or from the yoU@B student Diary
by entering the access credentials.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:6024px; width:455px; height:55px;
div.span:
The Bocconi students email address is composed of: the student ID number +
@studbocconi.it.
Students are also automatically assigned an alias address on the basis of possible
combinations of first name and surname, to help them use their Bocconi email accounts.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:6096px; width:168px; height:40px;
div.span: For more information

Technology Support for students
email: helpmail@studbocconi.it

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:6376px; width:478px; height:55px;
div.span:
The Bocconi email account, along with the yoU@B student Diary and the B in Touch
procedure, is the preferred channel to communicate to students; for this reason,
students are recommended to check their email account to read messages sent by the
University.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:6449px; width:447px; height:26px;
div.span:
Once students have received a Bocconi email account, they must use it along with B in
Touch for any communications to the University.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:6493px; width:466px; height:11px;
div.span: The University does not answer communications sent from private email addresses.

div.span: The
personalized Bocconi photo ID card
is an essential

non-transferable personal
document
used:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:6712px; width:296px; height:99px;
position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:6828px; width:434px; height:11px;
div.span: In addition, the
student ID card
is also enabled to be used for
banking operations

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:6858px; width:471px; height:40px;
div.span: Once the card has been activated for banking operations, contracts and payment services
will occur exclusively between the user and Banca Popolare di Sondrio,
without mediation
by the University.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:7268px; width:456px; height:40px;
div.span: On their yoU@B Diary, students can find the
‘Your ID Card’ widget

allowing them to
manage the deactivation/reactivation of the card and request a replacement in case their
card is lost/stolen. Specifically, they can:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:7356px; width:406px; height:70px;
div.span: print a
QR code
daily pass*

only valid to access University buildings;
temporarily
deactivate

the Bocconi ID card - for security reasons and only with
reference to services on campus;
reactivate
the Bocconi ID Card - only with reference to services on campus
request
a replacement card.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:7444px; width:467px; height:40px;
div.span: The QR Code pass will allow access to campus buildings with controlled entry, but it

will
not grant rights to other Bocconi services

(e.g. sitting exams, book loans at the Library,
etc.).

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:7502px; width:473px; height:114px;
div.span:
In addition, issuance of a QR Code will automatically deactivate the forgotten/lost card. To
use the forgotten student ID card again, students must enter the yoU@B Diary and click
‘
Reactivate your ID card

’ button.
If the card has been activated as a credit card, it can be
blocked

by following the procedure
described in 'Theft and Loss of ID card'.
Because the student ID card is an identification document essential for campus activities, in
case of a lost/stolen card, students must request a duplicate in accordance with what is
described in 'Theft and Loss of ID card'.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:7647px; width:108px; height:7px;
div.span: Last change 30/06/2023 12:12

div.span: Theft and loss of ID card

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:7780px; width:476px; height:26px;
div.span: If the personalized photo ID card has been
lost, stolen, damaged

or if the magnetic strip no
longer works, you should immediately:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:72px; top:7838px; width:437px; height:84px;
div.span:
1. deactivate it using the “Your ID Card” widget. This will ensure that your card is not
used improperly by third parties (e.g. to illegitimately take out book loans from the
Library);
in addition, if the card
has been activated for banking operations

, you should
immediately contact Banca Popolare di Sondrio to block the card at the phone
number: 800.822.056 (+39 02 60843768 for international calls).

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:8466px; width:477px; height:70px;
div.span: Only if the ID Card is lost or stolen

can a request for a replacement be made from yoU@B
through the “Your ID Card” widget.
In this case, a
26 fee will be charged for the
issue of a new Bocconi ID card

.
If a
previously lost card
is found after the replacement request has been made,

it cannot
be reactivated.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:8554px; width:471px; height:55px;
div.span: If the card is damaged or the magnetic strip is no longer working,

the student should
take the damaged card to the B in Touch Point so that it can be checked. In this case, there
is no charge for a replacement. If the student does not submit the damaged card, however,
the replacement fee will be charged.

Each student must have a personal laptop computer, with the following minimum
characteristics:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:9197px; width:331px; height:40px;

to take exams. For recommended hardware requirements: Current Students > Services >
ICT > Wi-Fi Activation > Hardware Requirements.

div.span: 3-Y DEGREE PROGRAM STRUCTURES

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:10995px; width:108px; height:7px;
div.span: Last change 01/06/2023 08:00

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:11025px; width:19px; height:11px;
position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:11054px; width:342px; height:11px;
div.span: Students Enrolled Starting from the 2018-2019 Academic Year

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:11127px; width:478px; height:69px;
div.span:
Through the joint agreement of the European Ministers of Education meeting in Bologna,
transformed the University reform of 1999 transformed the organization of the Italian
university. It changed the structure of both the study plan and the degree programs in the
fields of Economics and Management from one long four-year cycle to the so-called 3 plus 2,
divided into two cycles (undergraduate and graduate).

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:11215px; width:480px; height:40px;
div.span:
The result of a homogeneous course of studies in Europe was the free movement of students
within universities during their educational training and subsequently the movement of
graduates in the world of work.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:11273px; width:447px; height:26px;
div.span:
The two study cycles are to be considered separate; at the end of each, a final exam is
required, as well as the awarding of a diploma and the certification of the title obtained.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:11317px; width:480px; height:40px;
div.span: Once the 3-year cycle has been completed the student can decide whether to enter the world
of work or continue his/her university studies by enrolling in a graduate program (Master of
Science or a Specialized Master).

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:11375px; width:479px; height:40px;
div.span:
Since the start of the Bocconi University graduate programs, the selection process has been
distinct from that of the undergraduate one; therefore, admission to an undergraduate degree
program does not imply the automatic admission to a Master of Science program.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:11433px; width:455px; height:40px;
div.span:
The selection criteria for graduate programs are defined by the administration during the
annual plan of activities and are published on the website and in the Bocconi information
pack before the candidates' assessment procedure takes place.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:11492px; width:474px; height:11px;
div.span: For the
academic year, the Undergraduate School offers the following three-year

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:12619px; width:467px; height:26px;
div.span: and Global Law (BGL) are characterized by
specific course profiles

, starting with the first
year of studies.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:12663px; width:454px; height:26px;
div.span:
The structure of the programs with a shared disciplinary foundation is centered around 3
modules:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:12707px; width:440px; height:186px;
div.span: common foundation

: during the first 3 semesters the same subject foundation is
proposed for all Bachelor of Science programs. Basic knowledge concerning the
fields of political economics, corporate economics, and quantitative methods and law
is covered;
characterization of the Bachelor of Science programs

: the fourth semester and
part of the fifth deal with subjects which characterize the chosen study program.
Specifically, the subject matter of the program includes an in-depth understanding of
private and public enterprises and how they work, the finance sector, sectors that
deal with the general economic system, economics and the political-institutional and
social contexts, with a strong focus on internationalism;
individualizing the educational path

: in the fifth and especially in the sixth
semesters, students choose how to complete their educational path by sitting elective
exams which may be chosen selecting elective courses from among the general list.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:12911px; width:473px; height:69px;
div.span:
The class groups, comprised on average of 120 students for the programs taught in Italian
and 100 for the programs taught in English, with the exception of the class group for
Mathematical and Computing Sciences for Artificial Intelligence (BAI), which is comprised of
around 80 students and the class group for Global Law (BGL) which is comprised of around
50 students, are structured as follows:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:210px; top:13013px; width:6px; height:40px;

div.span: class groups in English

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:12999px; width:471px; height:244px;
div.span:
Bachelor of Science program class groups in Italian
CLEAM
CLEF
CLEACC
BESS
BIEM
BIEF
BIG
BEMACS

BAI
BGL
The program requirements are expressed in credit points.
A credit point is the unit of measurement which determines the workload students are
required to fulfill. It is assumed that students are adequately prepared from the start to carry
out the educational activities required by the study program. The workload includes both
classroom activities (lectures, exercises, seminars) and individual study, as well as other
educational activities such as preparation of the final paper.

div.span:

average 1 credit point corresponds to 25 hours of work for the student; about 8 hours, (but no

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:13584px; width:302px; height:11px;
div.span: To graduate, students must have earned
credit points.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:13613px; width:472px; height:40px;
div.span:
Credit points are given for all educational activities which students carry out, such as exams
for both compulsory and elective courses, language and IT exams, and preparation of the
final paper.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:13672px; width:456px; height:26px;
div.span:
Credit points do not substitute marks; they are given when passed exams are registered.
Credit points and marks make up the student's academic curriculum.

div.span: Educational Activities

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:13861px; width:477px; height:26px;
div.span:
The program structures are made up of a variety of educational activities to which credits are
assigned. Such activities can be divided as follows:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:13920px; width:436px; height:55px;
div.span: compulsory activities

: compulsory courses, first and second European language,
seminars, computer skills, final paper);
activity chosen by the student

: electives, activities carried out at other universities,
third language, internship).

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:13993px; width:437px; height:26px;
div.span: The student's individual study plan must include at least one course taught in English
(compulsory or elective).

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:14037px; width:462px; height:99px;
div.span:
For students to graduate, the university reform requires that they have knowledge of 2
European languages, for all programs in the fields of Economics and Management and
Political Sciences and International Relations (first and second language), for the BSc
in Mathematical and Computing Sciences for Artificial Intelligence belonging to the field in
Scienze matematiche and Global Law belonging to the field in Scienze dei Servizi
Giuridici the university reform requires that they have knowledge of 1 European language.
The rules for the choice of language courses are specified in chapter 3.1. Languages.

div.span: Compulsory Courses

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:14505px; width:478px; height:113px;
div.span: Every program structure includes
compulsory

courses, corresponding to exams that all
students enrolled in that program must pass.
Therefore, compulsory courses are essential in order to satisfy program requirements, and
are the fundamental building blocks for the educational objectives of the program. According
to current regulations such educational activities are classified as: "basic", "characteristic" of
the program's field of study, "similar or supplementary to the characteristic ones", with
particular regard to the cultural context and interdisciplinary education, and "independently
decided upon by the university".

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:14636px; width:478px; height:55px;
div.span:
The "Bachelor of Science program structures" chapter contains a section devoted to each
Bachelor of Science program where students can find the detailed program structure with the
list of all the compulsory courses, their credit point value and positioning in the program's
year of studies.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:14710px; width:426px; height:11px;
div.span: Course profiles
are available on the website at http://www.unibocconi.eu/courses.

selected by the students to complete their study plan. The elective course is worth 6 credit

div.span:
Before choosing their electives students should consult the "Table of incompatible courses",
the "Table of banned courses".
As an alternative to an elective course it is possible to carry out a curricular internship.

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:15879px; width:440px; height:26px;
div.span:
The Business Administration and Management (CLEAM) 3-y degree program has the
following educational objectives:

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:72px; top:15952px; width:439px; height:11px;
div.span: 1. provide a solid basic preparation in business, economics, quantitative and juridical

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:16008px; width:273px; height:9px;
div.span: © Università Bocconi - Via Sarfatti, 25 Milano - PI 03628350153

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:502px; top:16008px; width:52px; height:9px;

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:16187px; width:390px; height:26px;
div.span:
subject areas to critically understand the economic-juridical context in which
companies, public bodies, financial institutions work;

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:72px; top:16216px; width:438px; height:11px;
div.span: 2. provide a vast preparation in business subjects to ensure a command of all issues

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:16230px; width:441px; height:40px;
position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:72px; top:16274px; width:455px; height:55px;
div.span:
3. promote knowledge acquisition and the development of applied competences relative
to the various business functions (organization, strategy, accounting, planning and
control, marketing and sales, logistics, production and innovation, corporate finance,
etc.);

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:72px; top:16332px; width:458px; height:55px;
div.span:
4. develop competences besides knowledge via educational activities inside and outside
the classroom which promote student-teacher interaction and interaction between the
students themselves (ability to express their opinions, to work in group, to negotiate)
as well as developing problem setting and problem solving skills;

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:72px; top:16391px; width:448px; height:11px;
div.span: 5. develop competences to have a command of business, computer skills, and the use

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:16405px; width:389px; height:11px;
div.span: of two EU languages to be effective and efficient in the professional sphere;

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:72px; top:16420px; width:453px; height:11px;
div.span: 6. stimulate students to responsibly evaluate the consequences of their decisions in the

div.style: position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:88px; top:16434px; width:105px; height:11px;
div.span: professional sphere.
